results.title: Tony Oursler: Selected works
results.brief_description: These early examples of Oursler’s ingenious video theater are bizarre tales of good and evil. Crudely executed, they are as funny as they are chilling. Life is a series of spontaneous, dryly humorous episodes about the absurdity and grotesqueness of everyday life. Oursler writes: “When I look around I see that life is pregnant with pleasures and dangers. I get confused. We come down the chute and start out O.K. Then everything is go go go until you… you know what happens.” Diamond (Head) is a tale of lust and greed, starring a triangular-shaped cardboard protagonist who marries and has a “Good Son” — a small, foetus-shaped balloon. Good Things and Bad Things, which introduces Oursler’s recurring theme of the interdependence of good and evil, culminates in a wild vignette in which the artist plays the role of a young woman in a violent world turned sideways.

results.title: Tony Hunt: Kwakiutl artist
results.creator_credit: B T Film-Sound, North American Indian Films and Geoff Voyce
results.brief_description: Tony Hunt, a Kwakiutl Indian, is the grandson of the legendary Chief Mungo Martin. Since his initial tutoring by his grandfather, Tony has become an artist of international recognition capable of working in many art forms. In this film he makes a beautiful silver spoon.

constellations_other.name: Skate or die
constellations_other.description: Skateboarding is a subculture frequently documented, from amateur skate videos filmed with fish-eye lenses, to documentaries exploring the genesis of the subculture and gritty feature films depicting underlying social dynamics.

results.title: Tony Allcock's art of bowls: putting it all together
results.creator_credit: Pedigree Films, Mickey Shepherd and David Hall
results.brief_description: Tony Allcock, British and international indoors and outdoors bowls champion since 1976, explains and demonstrates the basics of lawn bowls which, in his opnion, is all about line, length and luck. Dispelling the myth that bowls is a game for the “oldies”, Tony is assisted by his much younger colleague, Andrew Wills, who represents the growing interest by young people in this game of skill and patience. Forward swing, backward swing, estimating line and length correctly, use of body weight and movement, judging the pace of the green and speed of follow through are all examined in great depth. To demonstrate the various techniques, the pair then play two ends - a short jack and a long jack. This step by step guide all takes place in an indoor bowls club.

results.title: Tons of teeth
results.brief_description: Describes causes, incidence and prevention of dental disease in both teeth and gums. Demonstrates preventive measures such as diet, toothbrushing, fluoridation and regular visits to the dentist.

results.title: Tonight and every night
results.brief_description: Rita Hayworth stars as Rosalind Bruce, a charismatic entertainer who, along with her showgirl colleagues, attempts to bring light relief from the ravages of war torn Britain. Romance develops between Rosalind and an RAF pilot Paul (Lee Bowman), who she meets during an air raid. Their relationship forms a delightful backdrop to the many entertaining musical numbers. Cast includes Janet Blair, Marc Platt, Leslie Brooks and Shelley Winters. Based on a play by Leslie Storm.

results.title: Toni
results.brief_description:
Toni, an immigrant Italian worker in Provence, falls in love with Josepha but she is already engaged to somebody else. Out of spite, he takes up with Marie and both weddings are celebrated on the same day. Toni and Josepha meet up years later, both unhappy in their respectives mariages. The result is a crime of passion. Following the example of Marcel Pagnol, Renoir completely abandoned the studio and filmed exclusively outdoors and in genuine interiors in the Midi, using authentic sound and actors from the region. The film is remarkable for its avoidance of the melodramatic, the depth and fluidity of the camerawork and the feeling for figures in a landscape. Reference: Bloomsbury Foreign Film Guide.

Credits: Director, Jean Renoir ; writers, Jean Renoir, Carl Einstein ; photography, Claude Renoir ; music, Paul Bozzi.
Cast: Charles Blavette, Jenny Helia, Edouard Delmont, Max Dalban, Andrex, Celia Montalvan.

results.title: Tongpan
results.brief_description: This documentary re-enactment made following the 1973 student rebellion which toppled the military junta in Thailand, is based on the experiences of a farmer from the poverty stricken north eastern region. It portrays the political and cultural gap that exists between peasant realities and the good intentions of the intelligentsia. In Thai with English subtitles.

results.brief_description: A cinematographic tour of the Pacific island kingdom of Tonga. Shows the natural beauty, the people, and the ceremonies of the island.

results.title: Tone, Touch and Technique for the Young Pianist
results.creator_credit: Television Production Unit Centre for the Study of Higher Education and University of Melbourne
results.brief_description: Max Cooke brings to life the theories of posture, gesture and co-ordination, which lead to ease and beauty in piano playing. Explanations about muscular control, finger action, the role of the arms and sense of touch lead directly to exercises for specific aspects of performance, and these in their turn lead to the application of the skills acquired in actual music examples.
